title: 8.Gandhi's Nonviolent Struggle
description: The inspiring story of Mahatma Gandhi and his philosophy of nonviolence, leading India to independence.

content.text: Mahatma Gandhi led India’s nonviolent struggle for independence, promoting peace and harmony even in the face of colonial oppression.
Gandhi organized the Salt March in 1930 to protest against British salt taxes, a pivotal moment in India's independence movement.

question.question: 2.What was the purpose of the Salt March?

content.text: Gandhi’s leadership inspired millions to join the struggle for independence through peaceful methods, gaining global recognition.
Mahatma Gandhi’s legacy is remembered not only for freeing India but for his principles of peace, tolerance, and unity.
Gandhi’s efforts toward peaceful independence have inspired civil rights movements worldwide, from the United States to South Africa.
